tool.name: SAGA.table_calculus.14
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayINPUT False isArrayFIELDS False isArrayCLUSTER False output_data_RESULT $output_data_RESULT output_data_STATISTICS $output_data_STATISTICS name SAGA.table_calculus.14 INPUT $INPUT FIELDS $FIELDS CLUSTER $CLUSTER METHOD $METHOD NCLUSTER $NCLUSTER NORMALISE $NORMALISE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_RESULT $OutputSection_RESULT.outputType_RESULT transmissionMode_RESULT $OutputSection_RESULT.transmissionMode_RESULT outputType_STATISTICS $OutputSection_STATISTICS.outputType_STATISTICS transmissionMode_STATISTICS $OutputSection_STATISTICS.transmissionMode_STATISTICS

param.name: INPUT
param.label: Shapes
param.help: Shapes The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, json, xml

param.name: FIELDS
param.label: Attributes
param.help: Attributes The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: CLUSTER
param.label: Cluster
param.help: Cluster The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: NORMALISE
param.label: Normalise
param.help: Automatically normalise grids by standard deviation before clustering.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_RESULT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_RESULT
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

section.name: OutputSection_STATISTICS
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_STATISTICS
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: Cluster Analysis for tables.<br/><br/>References:<br/><br/>Iterative Minimum Distance:<br/>- Forgy, E. (1965):<br/> 'Cluster Analysis of multivariate data: efficiency vs. interpretability of classifications',<br/> Biometrics 21:768<br/><br/>Hill-Climbing:- Rubin, J. (1967):<br/> 'Optimal Classification into Groups: An Approach for Solving the Taxonomy Problem',<br/> J. Theoretical Biology, 15:103-144<br/><br/>
